case_vignette: An 8-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his foster mother because of complaints from his teachers regarding poor performance at school for the past 8 months. He does not listen to their instructions, often talks during class, and rarely completes his school assignments. He does not sit in his seat in the classroom and often cuts in line at the cafeteria. His foster mother reports that he runs around a lot inside the house and refuses to help his sister with chores and errands. He frequently interrupts his foster mother's conversations with others and talks excessively. She has found him trying to climb on the roof on multiple occasions. He was placed in foster care because of neglect by his biological parents 3 years ago. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. Mental status examination shows a neutral affect.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have trouble paying attention in class, I talk a lot, and I don't finish my schoolwork.
How old are you?
I am 8 years old.
Are you facing any sleeping difficulties or challenges at home?
I run around a lot in the house and don't help with chores or errands.
Do you have periods where you are able to focus or does this happen all the time?
The teachers say I don't listen to instructions and I don't sit still in class, so it seems like it happens all the time.
Have your parents or teachers noticed these behaviors for more than six months?
Yes, my teachers have been complaining about my poor performance in school for the past 8 months.
Have you experienced any significant events or changes in your life around the time these symptoms started?
I was placed in foster care because of neglect by my biological parents 3 years ago.
I'm sorry to hear that. Have you been evaluated by a healthcare professional for these symptoms before?
No, this is my first time seeing a physician for these symptoms.
Do any of your biological family members have similar attention or behavioral issues?
I don't know about my biological family's health or if they have similar issues.
Do these symptoms occur in different settings, such as at home and at school?
Yes, I have these issues both at home and school.
Final Diagnosis: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

They are 8 years old and have a history of neglect, which led to being placed in foster care 3 years ago. Their teachers have been complaining about their poor performance in school for the past 8 months. This is their first time seeking medical help for these symptoms, and they are unaware of their biological family's health or if they have similar issues. These issues are present both at home and school.

Yes, they are consistent at both home and school.

The information about having trouble organizing tasks and activities is not provided, so I can't say if that's a problem I have.

The vignette does not mention whether I lose things often like school supplies or toys, so I cannot provide that information.

There's no information provided about my biological family's medical history or diagnoses.
